Package Screens

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • Screens.Screen
      • Screens.GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jay.jaysound.JayLayerListener
    public class GameScreen
extends Screen
implements jay.jaysound.JayLayerListener
    The GameScreen class combines all the Sprites together to run the actual game.
    Author:
    Kyle Fu

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Sets up the screen. Do not call this method manually.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the game state. Automatically called by draw().

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Updates and draws the GameScreen. Automatically called once per frame.
        Overrides:
        draw in class Screen

      • prepareRound

        public void prepareRound()
        Prepares a new round of the game, and then switches to the shop menu. Call this when starting a new round.

      • beginRound

        public void beginRound()
        Begins a round. Automatically called by ShopScreen.

      • endRound

        public void endRound()
        Ends a round, giving a point to the winner.

        public void startGame()
        Starts a new game (resets win counts).
